Question
========

A complete deck of 52 cards contains 13 diamond cards. Olivier plays together with his wife Maria. Olivier needs two more diamond cards to win from his wife. He currently has only two diamond cards and he knows that Maria has three cards, one of which is diamonds. What is Olivier's probability that the next two cards are both diamonds?

Answerlist
----------

* 0,04
* 0,20
* 0,21
* 0,25

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.04: Correct
* 0.20: Incorrect
* 0.21: Incorrect
* 0.25: Incorrect
